verses.verse: The words<WH1697> of Nehemiah<WH5166> the son<WH1121> of Hachaliah<WH2446>. And it came to pass in the month<WH2320> Chisleu<WH3691>, in the twentieth<WH6242> year<WH8141>, as I was in Shushan<WH7800> the palace<WH1002>,

That Hanani<WH2607>, one<WH259> of my brothers<WH251>, came<WH935>, he and certain men<WH582> of Judah<WH3063>; and I asked<WH7592> them concerning the Jews<WH3064> that had escaped<WH6413>, which were left<WH7604> of the captivity<WH7628>, and concerning Jerusalem<WH3389>.

And they said<WH559> unto me<WH7604>, The remnant that are left<WH7604> of the captivity<WH7628> there in the province<WH4082> are in great<WH1419> affliction<WH7451> and reproach<WH2781>: the wall<WH2346> of Jerusalem<WH3389> also is broken down<WH6555>, and the gates<WH8179> there are burned<WH3341> with fire<WH784>.

And it came to pass<WH8085>, when I heard these words<WH1697>, that I sat down<WH3427> and wept<WH1058>, and mourned<WH56> certain days<WH3117>, and fasted<WH6684>, and prayed<WH6419> before<WH6440> the God<WH430> of heaven<WH8064>,

And said<WH559>, I beg<WH577> you<WH3068>, O Lord God<WH430> of heaven<WH8064>, the great<WH1419> and terrible<WH3372> God<WH410>, that keeps<WH8104> covenant<WH1285> and mercy<WH2617> for them that love<WH157> him and observe<WH8104> his commandments<WH4687>:

Let your ear<WH241> now be attentive<WH7183>, and your eyes<WH5869> open<WH6605>, that you may hear<WH8085> the prayer<WH8605> of your servant<WH5650>, which I pray<WH6419> before<WH6440> you now<WH3117>, day<WH3119> and night<WH3915>, for the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> your servants<WH5650>, and confess<WH3034> the sins<WH2403> of the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>, which we have sinned<WH2398> against you<WH1>: both I and my father's house<WH1004> have sinned<WH2398>.

We have dealt very<WH2254> corruptly<WH2254> against you<WH8104>, and have not kept the commandments<WH4687>, nor the statutes<WH2706>, nor the judgments<WH4941>, which you commanded<WH6680> your servant<WH5650> Moses<WH4872>.

Remember<WH2142>, I beg you<WH1697>, the word that you commanded<WH6680> your servant<WH5650> Moses<WH4872>, saying<WH559>, If you transgress<WH4603>, I will scatter you abroad<WH6327> among the nations<WH5971>:

But if you turn<WH7725> unto me<WH8104>, and keep my commandments<WH4687>, and do<WH6213> them<WH5080>; though there were of you cast out unto the outermost part<WH7097> of the heaven<WH8064>, yet will I gather<WH6908> them from there<WH935>, and will bring them unto the place<WH4725> that I have chosen<WH977> to set<WH7931> my name there<WH8034>.
Now these are your servants<WH5650> and your people<WH5971>, whom you have redeemed<WH6299> by your great<WH1419> power<WH3581>, and by your strong<WH2389> hand<WH3027>.

O Lord<WH136>, I beg<WH577> you<WH241>, let now your ear be attentive<WH7183> to the prayer<WH8605> of your servant<WH5650>, and to the prayer<WH8605> of your servants<WH5650>, who desire<WH2655> to fear<WH3372> your name<WH8034>: and prosper<WH6743>, I pray you<WH5650>, your servant this day<WH3117>, and grant<WH5414> him mercy<WH7356> in the sight<WH6440> of this man<WH376>. For I was the king<WH4428>'s cupbearer<WH8248>.
